is nestled in the Jizera Mountains, at the foot of Ještěd mountain in the

value: metro station, the terminus station on the yellow line (B) up to 25 times per day with Student Agency
. Dopravní podnik města Liberce also operates a bus service from the same station. As of 2009, adult tickets are Kč 95 and journey time is 1 hour 5 minutes.
: Rail from Prague to Liberec is quite slow and there's no direct train from Prague. With change in Turnov the trip time is two times longer than by bus.
: 2h, four regional expresses a day. The

The train and bus station are next to each other. You can walk about 1 km to the city center or get a tram No 3. From there almost every sight can be reached on foot.

Liberec city transport
consists of trams, buses and a inter-city narrow gauge tram line to
stop. Single ticket costs Kč 20 (Kč 24 if bought at driver), one-day pass costs Kč 80. See city line map

.

If you travel outside Liberec, a good solution is the
, available at train stations. It's valid for one day in all trains and most of buses in Liberec region,
), as well as in cableway to Ještěd. Price is Kč 160 for one person or Kč 320 for group up to 5 people.

by David Černý. A table set with, among others, a carnivorous plant, knocked over menorah, German and Czech beer mugs and head of Konrad Henlein on a plate (all allusions to Liberec complex history).

content=Is a well-known dominant of Liberec city with a famous tower on the top. The tower built in 60's has an unique hyperboloid shape, naturally extending the silhouette of the mountain. It serves as a hotel and TV transmitter. By good weather you can overlook most of northern Bohemia as well as part of Germany and Poland from the summit. Take a tram No 3 to
and then either by hiking one of the trails or by cableway (Kč 60) to the top.
The city is famous worldwide for winter sporting events like FIS Nordic World Ski Championships 2009
or the Jizerské Mountains, where you can enjoy the majestic beauty of the Nordic nature on 115 km of cross-country paths.

content=
Rebuilt from an former textile factory, the Babylon is one of the largest Czech entertainment complexes. It offers aquapark, lunapark, 3D motion simulator, golf simulator, laser game, wellness center an many others.
at two golf resorts with an unforgettable atmosphere.

Very nice apartments close to the city center.

) are a true island of Scandinavian nature in central Europe. The central plateau with endless forests is ideal for hiking and cycling in summer or cross-country skiing in winter. Although in recent years crowds of tourists head there and the nature park authority issues too many car entry permits, you can find there a lot of quiet deserted places where only birches, pines and long grass whisper between rocks and boulders. Good start points to Jizera mountains are:
, easily reached by bus from Liberec, but also full of tourists
train station, ideal for exploring the Polish part of Jizera mountains

) are lower than Jizera mountains but also less touristy and surely worth to visit. Military enthusiasts will be interested in remnants of interwar Czechoslovak fortification system with a lot of deserted concrete bunkers. Good start points are
